page_title: Arc-like Sidebar | Your browser, brilliantly organized
page_desc: The ultimate Chrome sidebar tool combining bookmarks, vertical tabs, private AI grouping, and high customizability.
hero_badge: Now featuring local AI tab grouping
hero_subtitle:
Transform messy tabs into clear thoughts. Combining vertical tabs, seamless bookmarks, reading lists, and 100% local AI,
building your ultimate information command center.
features_subtitle: We've integrated all the tools you need into one elegant sidebar.
ai_desc: When you have dozens of tabs and don't know where to start, click a button, and AI will categorize them for you. Best of all, everything runs on your device via Gemini Nano. Data never leaves your machine.
drag_desc: We blurred the line between tabs and bookmarks. Drag a tab into a folder, and it becomes a bookmark. Pull a bookmark out, and it becomes an active tab.
theme_desc: Built-in beautiful themes, custom HSL colors support, and even custom background image uploads to build your unique sidebar style.
reading_desc: Don't let "read it later" become "never read it". A built-in article stash focused on information absorption.
rss_desc: Automatically fetch updates from your favorite tracking sites without installing extra readers.
privacy_desc: We believe great tools shouldn't cost you your privacy. That's why we use Chrome's built-in LanguageModel API to run AI grouping 100% locally on your device, instead of sending your every move to an external server.
more_subtitle: From search to keyboard control, every detail has been polished.
linked_desc: Opening a bookmark from the sidebar automatically creates a link, avoiding duplicate tabs and syncing state bidirectionally.
cross_window_desc: View and search tabs across all open Chrome windows, not just the current one.
search_desc: Multi-keyword filtering, domain search, and smart real-time highlighting—find anything instantly.
keyboard_desc: Arrow keys for navigation, F2 to rename, Delete to remove, Cmd/Ctrl+I to toggle the sidebar.
setup_subtitle: Just three steps to unlock AI smart grouping on your device.
setup_step1_desc: Navigate to chrome://flags/#optimization-guide-on-device-model and set it to "Enabled".
setup_step2_desc: Navigate to chrome://flags/#prompt-api-for-gemini-nano and set it to "Enabled" or "Enabled Multilingual".
setup_step3_desc: Restart Chrome, open DevTools Console and run await LanguageModel.availability(); — it should return "available".
setup_note: The official docs list English, Spanish, and Japanese as supported languages, but other languages actually work as well. If your language isn't on the official list, feel free to give it a try!
privacy_intro: Thank you for using the “Arc-like Sidebar” Chrome extension (hereinafter referred to as “the Extension”). We are committed to protecting your personal privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your information.
privacy_s1_desc: To provide its core functionality, the Extension requests read permissions for specific data from the Chrome browser. The types of information we access include:
privacy_s1_li1: Tabs and Tab Groups: URLs and titles of your open tabs, and titles/colors of tab groups.
privacy_s1_li2: Bookmarks: URLs, titles, and folder structure of all your bookmarks.
privacy_s1_li3: Reading List: URLs, titles, and read status of items in your Chrome Reading List.
privacy_s1_li4: Operational Data: State of “Linked Tabs”, UI state, RSS subscriptions, and hashes of fetched articles.
privacy_s2_desc: We follow the principle of data minimization and use different storage methods based on data type:
privacy_s2_li1: Local Data: Core operational data such as your tabs, bookmarks, Linked Tabs state, and hashes of fetched RSS articles are stored only in your device's chrome.storage.local. We do not upload this data to any servers.
privacy_s2_li2: Settings Sync: To provide a consistent experience, your preferences (e.g., themes, RSS list) are stored in chrome.storage.sync and synced securely via your Google account.
privacy_s3_desc: The Extension generally does not transmit your personal information externally. Exceptions involving external network requests are:
privacy_s3_li1: Bookmark Favicons: To display website icons, we send the domain (e.g., google.com) to Google's public Favicon service. We never transmit the full URL containing personal paths or parameters.
privacy_s3_li2: RSS Feed Fetching: The Extension periodically sends HTTP requests to your subscribed RSS feed URLs. These requests are limited to the URLs you actively subscribe to, and fetched content is only added to your Reading List, never sent to third-party servers.
privacy_s4_desc: The Extension uses the following Chrome permissions:
privacy_s4_td1: Read tab information to display and manage tabs in the sidebar.
privacy_s4_td2: Read and manage titles and colors of tab groups.
privacy_s4_td3: Read and manage the bookmark list.
privacy_s4_td5: Store extension settings and operational state.
privacy_s4_td6: Manage Chrome Reading List (add/remove/mark as read).
privacy_s4_td7: Schedule background fetching tasks for RSS subscriptions.
privacy_s4_td8: Process XML parsing of RSS feeds in the background.
privacy_s4_td9: Used to fetch RSS feed content and display bookmark favicons.
privacy_s5_desc: All accessed information is strictly used for:
privacy_s5_li1: Rendering and presenting your tabs and bookmarks in the sidebar.
privacy_s5_li2: Enabling management operations (searching, sorting, grouping, closing, deleting).
privacy_s5_li3: Managing your Chrome Reading List and RSS feed content.
privacy_s5_outro: Your data will never be used for advertising, tracking, or other analytical purposes.
privacy_s6_desc: This extension is 100% open-source software under the MIT License. We welcome anyone to review our code to verify this Privacy Policy.
privacy_s7_desc: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page.
privacy_s8_desc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact:
changelog_subtitle: See what's new, improved, and fixed in recent updates.
changelog_read_more: Read full release notes on GitHub
v1_13_3_desc: Fixed an issue where background RSS fetching would occasionally drop connections, ensuring your feeds are updated reliably. We also optimized the way background files are packaged for better performance.
v1_13_2_desc: Enhanced our RSS fetcher to smoothly support more websites, including Substack. Your information flow is now less restricted than ever.
v1_13_1_desc: We solved a "failed to load" error that occurred when subscribing to new RSS feeds from the sidebar. We've also massively upgraded bookmark rendering performance, making list scrolling buttery smooth, alongside crucial UI security patches.
v1_14_0_desc: Massive update! Introducing the experimental 'Local AI Auto-Grouping' to organize your tabs with a single click. You can now manually switch the UI language to any of 14 supported languages from the settings! Plus, a completely overhauled official website and multiple UX enhancements including RSS.
guide_subtitle: From installation to advanced control, master every function of the sidebar step by step.
guide_start_step1: Go to the <a href="https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/sidebar-for-tabsbookmarks/beoonblekmppafnjppedgpgfngghebji" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Chrome Web Store
guide_start_step2: After the installation is complete, click on the extension icon (puzzle icon) in the upper right corner of the Chrome toolbar, find "Arc-like Sidebar" and pin it.
guide_start_step3: Click the icon or use the shortcut <kbd>Cmd/Ctrl + I
guide_start_tip: Tip: After opening the sidebar for the first time, press any direction key to automatically gain focus and start keyboard navigation.
guide_tabs_desc: The sidebar will display all the tabs of the current window vertically, allowing you to see the complete titles at a glance, instead of being compressed into small icons like the traditional horizontal tab column.
guide_groups_desc: Fully integrates Chrome's native paging group functionality. The name and color of the group will be displayed simultaneously.
guide_bm_desc: A complete bookmark browser is built into the sidebar, which directly displays the structure of your bookmark folders and supports expansion, search and drag operations.
guide_linked_desc: This is our most unique feature! When you open a bookmark from the sidebar, the system will automatically create a "link" between the bookmark and the tab to help you avoid opening it repeatedly and synchronize the status in real time.
guide_linked_tip: The link state is persisted through Local Storage and will not be lost even if the browser is restarted.
guide_window_desc: Not just the current window! The sidebar displays an "Other Windows" section below the pagination list, letting you know the pagination status of all Chrome windows.
guide_search_desc: The search box at the top of the sidebar provides a powerful real-time filtering function, allowing you to instantly lock in your target among dozens of tabs and thousands of bookmarks.
guide_reading_desc: The sidebar deeply integrates Chrome's native reading list, allowing you to manage "read later" articles without switching panels.
guide_rss_desc: No need to install additional readers! Subscribe to the RSS feed of websites you are interested in in the settings panel, and the system will automatically schedule to fetch the latest articles and add them to the reading list.
guide_ai_desc: With Chrome's built-in Gemini Nano native AI, scattered pages can be automatically classified into groups based on semantics with just one click. All processing takes place 100% on your device, and data is never uploaded to the cloud.
guide_ai_step1: Make sure you have completed <a href="index.html#ai-setup">AI feature setup
guide_ai_step2: Click the "✨ Smart Organizing" button in the sidebar.
guide_ai_step3: All uncategorized tabs (at least 4 required) will be scanned and analyzed by the AI within seconds.
guide_ai_step4: Paginations are automatically moved into groups with emojis and descriptive names.
guide_ai_undo_tip: Not satisfied with the classification results? don’t worry! After the organization is completed, the "Undo" button will be displayed. Click to restore to the state before organization.
guide_theme_desc: The sidebar provides canvas-level visual customization capabilities, from preset themes to fully customized, to create your own unique tool.
guide_theme_preset_desc: A variety of beautiful built-in themes (Geek, Google, Darcula, Geek-Blue, Christmas, etc.) can be switched with one click in the settings.
guide_theme_custom_desc: After selecting the "Custom" theme, you can freely set the three core colors through the color selector - the main background color, accent color and text color. The system will automatically derive a harmonious auxiliary color chip through the HSL algorithm to ensure that the WCAG contrast ratio meets the standard.
guide_theme_share_desc: Export your custom colors as a JSON file to share with friends, or load themes shared by others to quickly apply popular colors in the community.
guide_kb_desc: The sidebar supports a complete keyboard operation experience, allowing advanced users to complete all operations without a mouse.
guide_kb_newtab: Create a new tab next to the current tab
guide_kb_updown: Move focus between tabs, groups, and bookmarked items
guide_kb_leftright: Action buttons for entering/leaving the project (close, edit, etc.)
guide_kb_enter: Perform main actions (switch pagination, expand folders)
guide_kb_focus_tip: Focus Tip: When focus is at the top of the list, press <kbd>↑
guide_cta_desc: Install now and give your Chrome a new look.
hover_summarize_desc: Hover over a tab for 2 seconds and AI generates a one-sentence summary instantly. No more blind clicking.
modern_ui_desc: Deeply polished glassmorphism design and silky micro-animations for the ultimate browsing experience.
compare_h1:
Not More Settings, But
Better Experience
compare_subtitle: We are not aiming to be a 'Swiss Army Knife' with 100+ toggles. We focus on building an out-of-the-box, elegant, and 100% privacy-safe browser sidebar.
compare_row1_us: Zero-config (Built-in Local AI)
compare_row1_allinone: Requires Manual API Key
compare_row1_traditional: No AI Integration
compare_row2_us: Minimalist Arc Style & Micro-animations
compare_row2_allinone: Focus on Feature Density over Visuals
compare_row2_traditional: Native Browser UI
compare_row3_us: 100% Offline Analysis
compare_row3_allinone: Sends Data to 3rd-Party APIs
compare_row3_traditional: Offline
compare_row4_us: Opinionated Best Defaults
compare_row4_allinone: 100+ Settings, Steep Learning Curve
compare_row4_traditional: Simple & Intuitive
compare_row5_us: First-of-its-kind Hover Summaries
compare_row5_allinone: Unsupported
compare_row5_traditional: Unsupported
compare_cta_text: We believe good tools should filter distractions, not fill your screen with unnecessary switches.
compare_btn_install: Install now to feel the difference
guide_ai_hover_desc: Not sure what a tab is about? Hover your cursor over any loaded tab in the sidebar for 2 seconds. The system will use local AI to read the page content in real-time and generate a concise one-sentence summary.
guide_ai_hover_step1: Ensure you have completed the AI Setup.
guide_ai_hover_step2: Enable 'Hover Smart Summarize' in the 'Experimental Features' section of the sidebar's settings panel.
guide_ai_hover_step3: Hover your cursor over any fully loaded tab for 2 seconds.
guide_ai_hover_step4: The summary panel will elegantly appear, streaming the summary text word by word.
guide_ai_hover_lang_limit: Language Support Limitation: Due to the current language support in the underlying Gemini Nano model, this feature can only reliably generate summaries in Japanese, English, and Spanish. Users of other languages will currently receive English summaries. We will support more languages as soon as Chrome rolls out new model updates.
